pullRequest.body:
These are analogous to the existing `Polynomial.coe_add` and `Polynomial.coe_zero`, about the coercion from `Polynomial` to `PowerSeries`.

[Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/.60.281.20-.20X.20.3A.20.E2.84.A4.5BX.5D.29.2EtoPowerSeries.20.3D.201.20-.20.28PowerSeries.2EX.20.3A.20.E2.84.A4.E2.9F.A6X.E2.9F.A7.29.60/near/483708229).

nodes.body:
### PR summary [680e68bfb9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19339/commits/680e68bfb909b9e55e5845b7abaa26cf3cb17bd6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ coe_neg`
`+ coe_sub`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors merge

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11977766482/job/33396375711)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11977766482/job/33396376345)
A minor style point: these blank lines are mostly a mathport-ism
This one looks a bit too specialized. Do we have the same for other coercions?
I agree, I think we should remove this one.
This section is currently in the middle of a section about `CommSemiring`; can you wrap the existing material in a `section` too, and make sure they don't overlap?

> Sorry I'm not sure about what you mean by "wrapping the existing material in a `section`". Shall I move the section `CommRing` elsewhere so that it is not a subsection of any section?

Sorry I'm not sure about what you mean by "wrapping the existing material in a section". Shall I move the section `CommRing` elsewhere so that it is not a subsection of any section?

a style nit:
```suggestion
section CommRing
variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R]
```

```suggestion
section CommSemiring
```
(by which I mean, delete the blank line below)
Can you write these in the same style as `coe_add` above? That is, without using `.toPowerSeries`.
What's going on here? Which `coe_sub` was this before, and is this new one somehow the right one?
It would be great to replace this `erw` with a `rw` if possible to clear this up.

> What's going on here? Which `coe_sub` was this before, and is this new one somehow the right one?

Yeah I think the `coe_sub` before actually meant `PowerSeries.coe_sub`. Because I have created another declaration `Polynomial.coe_sub`, an error message appearred that lean couldn't recognize which `coe_sub` was being used in the proof, due to ambiguity. Hence I explicitly added `PowerSeries.`.
Ah apologies, I was confusing `Polynomial.coe_sub` and `PowerSeries.coe_sub`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/PowerSeries/Basic): `Polynomial.coe_sub` and `Polynomial.coe_neg`
